abstract.text: A type that describes a CloudKit error.

inlineContent.text: CloudKit provides operations that faciliate moving data between your app and iCloud. There are also convenience methods in

that provide similar functionality. If an operation or method fails to complete its task, CloudKit provides detailed error information that you can use to recover. A failure might be due to network or server conditions, or because of conflicts between local and remote data. For a list of possible reasons, see
If you receive an error, cast it to an instance of
to access additional information that CloudKit provides. For example, if the error code is
property to determine how long you must wait before you retry the operation or method.
error. This means only a subset of the operationâ€™s changes succeed. Use the
property to access a dictionary that maps items that CloudKit canâ€™t process to errors that describe those failures. You can then handle each error independently.

properties to resolve the conflict. Make sure you merge any changes into
because that version contains the most recent change tag.
